snippet: A lawsuit filed by the American Civil Liberties Union accuses the public defender’s office of leaving defendants in jail with no one to challenge or negotiate their cases.
abstract: American Civil Liberties Union files class-action suit in Federal District Court in New Orleans over ineffectiveness of city's system of funding public defender program primarily through parking violation fees; suit follows announcement by New Orleans Public Defenders office that it will begin refusing some felony cases due to underfunding and overload; lawsuit also notes public defender program imposed hiring freeze in July that led to dismissal of significant number of lawyers.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed by the American Civil Liberties Union accuses the public defender’s office of leaving defendants in jail with no one to challenge or negotiate their cases.

headline.main: New Orleans Puts Poor on ‘Waiting List’ for Lawyers, Suit Alleges
headline.print_headline: Suit Describes ‘Waiting List’ for Legal Aid in New Orleans
